Keyword.name: LIST_COUNT
Keyword.description: list_count(profiles.beacons.ts, to_epoch_time('2011_08_01'), to_epoch_time('2011_09_01')) returns the count of beacon fires in August.

Keyword.name: LIST_MAX
Keyword.description: list_max(profiles.beacons.ts) returns the max timestamp of the beacon fires in the targeted date range (in DATES clause).

Keyword.name: LIST_MIN
Keyword.description: list_min(profiles.beacons.ts) returns the min timestamp of the beacon fires in the targeted date range (in DATES clause).

Keyword.name: LIST_HAS
Keyword.description: list_has(profiles.beacons.beacon_id, 123, 234) returns true if user has any beacon fires with id being either (123 or 234) in the targeted date range (in DATES clause).

Keyword.name: LIST_SUM
Keyword.description: list_sum(profiles.impressions.cost) returns the sum of impression cost in the targeted date range (in DATES clause).

Keyword.name: FOR_MARKET_
Keyword.description: Turn Datamine user only - choose the market for ICA relational query or the AUP for profile query

Keyword.name: SAMPLE
Keyword.description: Cheetah Analytics only - apply the query to a sample of users (on AUP query) or events (on ICA)

Keyword.name: TEST
Keyword.description: Cheetah Analytics only - test running your query

Keyword.name: LIMIT
Keyword.description: Cheetah Analytics only - work with ORDER BY to get 'top k' results

Table.name: dmp.data
Table.example: select data_provider_name, contract_name, count(distinct user_id) cat_UU From dmp.data Dates [2012_04_01, 2012_04_25] where data_provider_id in (18130977, 3310169) order by category_name

Column.name: impression_id
Column.description: A random number to distinguish the impressions of a user

Column.name: media_provider_name
Column.description: An impression could come from different media providers, like 'Turn'

Table.name: dmp.segments
Table.description: 1% of data is applied for Turn

market.name: One to One Interactive Trading Desk

Column.name: beacon_id
Column.description: targeted conversion beacon id, only in transaction table

Column.name: beacon_name
Column.description: targeted conversion beacon name, only in transaction table

Column.name: data_cost
Column.description: Cost for using data in TAP

Column.name: fifth_beacon_id
Column.description: The ID of the fifth latest beacon according to the same advertiser (note it could be from different advertiser if less than 5 beacons exist for that advertiser)

Column.name: fifth_behavior_id
Column.description: The ID of the fifth latest behavior according to the same advertiser (note it could be from different advertiser if less than 5 behaviors exist for that advertiser)

Column.name: first_beacon_id
Column.description: The ID of the latest beacon according to the same advertiser

Column.name: first_behavior_id
Column.description: The ID of the latest behavior according to the same advertiser

Column.name: fourth_beacon_id
Column.description: The ID of the fourth latest beacon according to the same advertiser

Column.name: fourth_behavior_id
Column.description: The ID of the fourth latest behavior according to the same advertiser

Column.name: impression
Column.description: 1 or more (adjustment) for impressions, 0 for publisher default

Column.name: mobile_device_model
Column.description: Derived from user_agent for mobile targeting

Column.name: mobile_device_type
Column.description: Derived from user_agent for mobile targeting

Column.name: mobile_device_manufacturer
Column.description: Derived from user_agent for mobile targeting

Column.name: mobile_device_os
Column.description: Derived from user_agent for mobile targeting

Column.name: mobile_device_os_version
Column.description: Derived from user_agent for mobile targeting

Column.name: second_beacon_id
Column.description: The ID of the second latest beacon according to the same advertiser

Column.name: second_behavior_id
Column.description: The ID of the second latest behavior according to the same advertiser

Column.name: third_beacon_id
Column.description: The ID of the third latest beacon according to the same advertiser

Column.name: third_behavior_id
Column.description: The ID of the third latest behavior according to the same advertiser

Column.name: win
Column.description: 1 for winning bid, 0 for losing or no bid

Column.name: contract_id
Column.description: contract that contributes to the impression

Column.name: contract_name
Column.description: contract that contributes to the impression

Column.name: creation_ts
Column.description: profile creation time in epoch time seconds

Column.name: data_provider_id
Column.description: provider that contributes to the impression

Column.name: data_provider_name
Column.description: provider that contributes to the impression

Column.name: last_modified_ts
Column.description: most recent time the profile is updated, epoch time in seconds

Column.name: mp_advertiser_id
Column.description: meta data used at Media provider side

Column.name: rule_num
Column.description: segment rule that qualified for the impression

Column.name: advertiser_id
Column.description: DMP advertiser id (-1 for user data)

Examples.name: Examples
Examples.Example: select to_date(ts), sum(impression), sum(click), sum(action), sum(tap_action) from dmp.impressions, dmp.clicks, dmp.actions, dmp.tap_actions dates [2012_04_10, 2012_04_30] order by to_date(ts)
select impression_date, sum(impression), sum(click), sum(action) from impressions, clicks, actions dates [2012_04_10, 2012_04_30] where advertiser_id > 0 order by impression_date
select to_date(ts), data_provider_id, count(distinct user_id) from dmp.data dates 2012_03_10 where market_id in (-1, 1, 100) order by data_provider_id

Example.name: dmp.segments
Example.description: A query on dmp.segments table; note that 1% of AUP is evaluated if it is run on Turn's AUP

Examples.Example: select select segment_id, count(*) from dmp.segments dates 2012_04_10

select data_provider_name, contract_name, category_fullpath_name, category_name, category_id, count(distinct user_id) cat_UU From dmp.data Dates [2012_04_01, 2012_04_25] where data_provider_id in (18130977, 3310169, 19192919) order by category_name

select data_provider_name, contract_name, category_name, count(distinct user_id) UU, sum(distinct case when list_has(dmp.impressions.mp_insertion_order_id, 910928843) then 1 else 0 end) impression_UU, sum(distinct case when list_has(dmp.actions.mp_insertion_order_id, 910928843, dmp.actions.action, 1) then 1 else 0 end) action_UU, sum(distinct case when list_has(dmp.data.category_id, category_id) then 1 else 0 end) from dmp.data dates [2011_12_01,2012_03_11] where data_provider_name like '%always%' order by category_name

select data_provider_name, contract_name, category_name, count(distinct user_id) UU, sum(distinct list_count(dmp.actions.mp_insertion_order_id, 910928843, dmp.actions.action,1,dmp.actions.ts,0,9999999999)) actions, sum(distinct list_count(dmp.impressions.mp_insertion_order_id, 910928843,dmp.impressions.ts,0,9999999999)) impressions, castlong(sum(distinct list_sum(dmp.impressions.mp_insertion_order_id,910928843,dmp.impressions.cost))) cost from dmp.data dates [2011_12_01,2012_03_11] where data_provider_name like '%always%' order by category_name

select CASTLONG((list_max(dmp.data.contract_id, 18231125, 18234522, dmp.data.ts) - list_min(dmp.data.contract_id, 18192520, dmp.data.ts))/86400 / list_count(dmp.data.contract_id, 18231125, dmp.data.ts, 0, 9999999999)), count(distinct user_id) From dmp.data Dates [2012_01_05, 2012_01_10] Where list_count(dmp.data.contract_id, 18231125, dmp.data.ts, 0, 9999999999) > 1

select data_provider_name, data_provider_id, contract_name, contract_id, category_name, category_id, count(distinct user_id) cat_UU, sum(distinct list_sum_range(aip.actions.mp_insertion_order_id, 917334196, aip.actions.action, 1, aip.actions.mp_package_id, 917335699, 917335116, aip.actions.ts, to_epoch_time('2012_03_09'), to_epoch_time('2012_03_15')+86399, aip.actions.shopping_cart_value)) adv_rev from aip.data dates [2012_02_10, 2012_03_15] where not data_provider_name like '%advertiser%' and not data_provider_name like '%hp%'

Example.name: data query 1
Example.description: Count of distinct users, and fires, on a pixel by day

Examples.Example: select to_date(ts), count(distinct user_id), count(*) from profiles.beacons dates [2012_01_10, 2012_01_11] where beacon_id = ??

Example.name: User Profile Analysis
Example.description: Find out the ICA distribution of users in terms of their gender, geo

Examples.Example: select to_date_2(impression_datetime), case when gender = -1 then 'Unknown' when gender = 1 then 'Male' else 'Female' end gender, target_page_postal_code zipcode, sum(impression) imps,sum(click) clicks, sum(action) actions from impressions, clicks, actions DATES [2012_01_01,2012_01_31]

Example.name: User Counting
Example.description: Find out the number of users

Examples.Example: select count(distinct user_id) from dmp dates 2012_05_29
